title: Adjectives - comparative or superlative?
instructions: Complete the sentences with the B1comparativeB2 or B1superlativeB2 forms of the adjectives. Sometimes you will need to supply 'the'.

explain: Corr: more. We need the comparative because there's 'than' in the sentence.
Corr: the most romantic. We need the superlative because we want to say that there's no more romantic film than Casablanca.

sentence: I didn't sleep well, so I am
(tired) now than I was last night.
explain: Corr: more tired. We need the comparative because there's 'than' in the sentence.
Corr: the strongest. We need the superlative because we want to say there's no stronger drink in this pub than this.
Corr: the highest. We need the superlative because there's no higher mountain than Mount Everest.
Corr: the longest. We need the superlative because we're not comparing two things, we want to know the bridge that is longer than all the other bridges.

sentence: The present I bought your wife is
(expensive) than the present you bought for her.
explain: Corr: more expensive. We need the comparative because there's 'than' in the sentence.
Corr: best. We need the superlative here. We don't need 'the' because there's a possessive before the adjective.

sentence: Why is it that my suitcase is
explain: Corr: the heaviest. We need the superlative. We want to say that no other suitcases are heavier than ours.
Corr: greener. We need the comparative form because there's 'than' in the sentence.
